Dialogue.NPCText:
You see a young woman dusted with pollen, her eyes watery but determined. Woven garlands crown her hair, and she clutches a satchel bursting with seeds and herbs.

"Achoo! Oh—blessings of the grove! Sorry, the wind stirs the pollen something fierce today.
I'm Nali Swiftseed, runner of herbs and seeds. If you aren't here to trample seedlings, maybe you can help. The paths are getting... dangerous."

Option.text: What does a Seed Runner do?
Tell me more about you and the Verdant way.
I have no time for the woods.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She smiles weakly.

"Born here, raised by the wild. My family has run seeds and medicine between the huts since before the tribes were many. The wind calls, so I run—no matter how much I sneeze. The spirits must find it funny."
Her nose twitches.
"Can I tempt you into helping instead?"

Option.text: Tell me about the Seed Runners.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Seed Runners carry hope from hut to hut—new crops, rare medicine, stories, even gossip. I know every deer trail and secret root between here and the distant groves. If you need a shortcut, a safe crossing, or healing herbs, come to me."

She glances nervously at the forest's edge.
"Though these days, even I get nervous out there."

Option.text: What makes the forest so dangerous now?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nali rubs her nose, eyes watering.
"A lifetime among the flowers, and they still get the better of me! Nature's little joke, I suppose."

"But pollen or not, someone has to keep the green alive while the rest fight or argue. Achoo!"
"Will you help with a delivery—or at least walk the dangerous path with me?"

Option.text: What's so dangerous about the path?
Blessings of the wild, but not today.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She lowers her voice.

"The east route to Elderheart Hollow is overrun by thorn demons—twisted vines, claws, eyes in the bark. Minax’s shadow, or so the elders say. My usual shortcuts are tangled or worse."
"I must reach the outpost with medicine, but alone I won’t make it. Will you come—fight if you must, sneak if you’re clever? There may be other ways to clear the path, if you look sharp."

Option.text: I prefer stealth—any advice for sneaking?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nali brightens.
"You’re wise! Thorn demons can’t see well, but they feel every vibration. Step lightly, use pollen poultices to mask your scent, and beware the red blossom traps—they burst if touched."
"I’ll pack a few poultices for you. Will you try to slip past with me?"

Option.text: On second thought, fighting is better.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She leans close.
"There is a hidden root tunnel—if you can open the old druidic lock. Find three mossy stones near the old spirit totem. Press them in order: North, then East, then West. The ground will open."
"Or so the stories go! Shall we try it together?"

Option.text: Yes, show me the secret way!
I'll stick to the main path.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nali hands you a small satchel fragrant with herbs.

"Take this Seed Satchel to Elderheart Hollow. Protect it—thorn demons crave the scent of what’s inside. I’ll follow your lead, whether you fight, sneak, or find the secret tunnel. Once we’re safe, the outpost will reward you, and I’ll owe you a favor."
She sneezes, grinning.
"Ready when you are!"

Nali pauses, her expression softening as she runs fingers across a vine-bound bracelet.

"The Verdant way isn't just about trees and dirt. It's about *balance*. We grow what we take, give when we can, and listen when the forest speaks."
"I wasn't always a runner. I used to be a weaver like my grandmother—until the storms came and the beasts rose. We all had to adapt."

Option.text: You were a weaver? What changed?
What do you mean the forest speaks?
You carry that balance even with the allergies?
That's interesting, but I should move on.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She sighs, shoulders tightening.

"When Minax's shadow first touched the earth, things began to twist. Thorn demons were just the start. Deer began screaming like wolves. Even roots snapped like jaws."
"That’s when I stopped weaving and started running—medicine, seeds, warnings. Movement kept us alive."

Option.text: How did you survive the worst of it?
It must be hard to lose your old life.
What does the forest say about Minax?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nali chuckles softly.

"I used to spend days making tapestries of vines and pollen-thread. I’d sit by the elderfire and listen to the wind, waiting for dreams."
"But dreams don’t deliver medicine to wounded scouts. Threads don’t guide orphans out of thistle pits. Running became my calling."

"Though I still carry a needle tucked in my belt—just in case the world ever slows down again."

Option.text: Can I see your old work?
Your spirit is strong. I admire that.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Some nights, I miss the quiet. The smell of dyed leaves, the soft creak of a loom branch. But every herb I deliver, every life I help protect..."
She places a hand over her heart.
"That *matters* more. And so I run. Even with itchy eyes."

She brightens.

"You'd like to learn? Maybe after all this—when the woods settle and the pollen sleeps—I’ll teach you the warp and weft of spirit vines."
"But beware: needle-pricks sting worse than thorns!"

Nali eyes you thoughtfully.

"You've got a kind aura. Maybe it’s time this had a new home."
She reaches into her pouch and offers you a delicate woven charm—glowing faintly with spirit sap.

Option.text: I can't accept such a gift.

Dialogue.NPCText:
She crouches, fingers brushing a leaf.

"The forest speaks in rustles and whispers, in sudden silence and unexpected bloom. The Verdant shamans read omens in moss. I read them in pollen routes."
"Right now? The forest is uneasy. It twists where it should grow. It *remembers* Minax."

Option.text: Can you teach me to read those signs?

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nali points to a feather charm at her belt.

"I survived because the wind loved me. Or because I learned to listen. Or maybe just luck."
"We don’t always get to choose how we survive. Only what we do with it after."

She laughs nervously.

"Brave? I still flinch when mushrooms pop. But I keep moving. That’s all bravery is, I think—running even when you sneeze the whole way."

Option.text: Back to the task at hand…

Dialogue.NPCText:
Nali grins mid-sneeze.

"Balance means even the itchy parts matter! Achoo!"
"Besides, someone has to remind the world that stubbornness is a virtue."
